Kerri Marusiak

Dog-Lover | Web Developer | Woodworker

Hello!



I'm Kerri, and I have recently entered the world of coding! I took the plunge, and attended an intensive four month web development programme at We Got Coders. Through morning lectures, afternoon pair programming, and evening self study I have developed a solid understanding of Ruby and developed a strong interest in database structures and Javascript. I've completed the training phase, and am now excited to continue my path as a web developer by getting my foot in the door at a great company and putting my skills to work in the real world.

Having formerly trained as a cabinetmaker I worked to create precise, functional furniture. I developed an eye for design, and could fuss over even the smallest details of a project. Some might say I'm a bit particular, but I like to think that these skills will serve me well as I transition into my new career as a web developer.

Skills.

  • TypeScript

  • Ruby on Rails

  • Jira, Confluence, Monday

Work.

TouchNote

I started at TouchNote as an intern in August 2018, after completing a four month coding bootcamp with a strong focus on Ruby and Ruby on Rails.

My first task at TouchNote? Learn to work with Angular! As an intern, I developed the company's internal tools site, while getting to know their product as well as learning the fundamentals of what was for me at the time, a new programming language. After an intial four month period, I was hired on a permanent basis, and migrated to contributing to the customer-facing app.

As (at times), the only web developer at TouchNote, I had the opportunity to take on a multitude of responsibilties. In addition to making regular releases and keeping(soemthing something ) up to date, something something all and ensuring the performance of the web app, I also contributed to writing documentation for web app product flows and tech specs.

features here i can talk anout some of my favo features - text stickers, card chart?? , csv uploader

Perhaps my greatest achievment at TouchNote was inspiring the office's Pet Policy to be written, and my dog Bella's subsequent promotion to 'Lead Doggo' within the company. She even got her own canvas printed and hung on the wall!

This page tells you a little bit about me.

Judith's Kitchen

This is a personal project which I initially started back when I was first learning Angular. I followed an online program, over the course of which you are led to develop a very simple recipe site, not an uncommon subject for beginner code projects. I completed the course, and that was that.

One day however, almost two years latesr, I found myself searching through old emails for a recipe my mom sent me and having no luck at finding it. I remembered this old recipe project and thought if I could resurrect it, with my now more developed skills, i could make it into actually a really useful tool for my mom and I to share our recipes from afar. (she is back home on the west coast of Canada), and never to need to dig for or lose recipes again! So I set about revamping it with my , adding new features with the idea of making it so simple and starightforward that even mom would enjoy using it! It is currently still a work in prgress, but it is developed to the point where I do in fact use it, and I am currently adding recipes and developing new features on a regular basis

features includes: add new recipe, favourite recipe list, tags, no tracking ads or other bloating, add notes and view other user's notes, add dates recipe made, search for recipes, shopping/ingredient checklist on mobile

This page tells you a little bit about me.

Memoria

Memoria

Memoria was my final project I developed for my coding bootcamp. I am guilty of always having a million tabs open at once, because I always feel that if I close them I will never remember to come back to that page again. So, enter Memoria! A bookmarking app which takes a screenshot of the page you are viewing to give you that visual memeory jog, and saves it as a bookmark to your Memoria homescreen.

Memoria allows users at the click of a button store bookmarks into their homepage, complete with a screenshot of the page they are browsing to help jog their memory, the title of the page, and optional user-added tags. This works via a chrome extension which can be installed in the browser, and makes the ajax request to populate the user's home page. I built the app and the extension myself from scratch, with a rails backend and vanilla javascript frontend, and hosting on Heroku.

This page tells you a little bit about me.
